00027 /**
00028  * @brief Spawning of Ruby on Rails application instances.
00029  *
00030  * This class is responsible for spawning new instances of Ruby on Rails applications.
00031  * Use the spawn() method to do so.
00032  *
00033  * @note This class is fully thread-safe.
00034  *
00035  * <h2>Implementation details</h2>
00036  * Internally, this class makes use of a spawn server, which is written in Ruby. This server
00037  * is automatically started when a SpawnManager instance is created, and automatically
00038  * shutdown when that instance is destroyed. The existance of the spawn server is almost
00039  * totally transparent to users of this class. Spawn requests are sent to the server,
00040  * and details about the spawned process is returned.
00041  *
00042  * If the spawn server dies during the middle of an operation, it will be restarted.
00043  * See spawn() for full details.
00044  *
00045  * The communication channel with the server is anonymous, i.e. no other processes
00046  * can access the communication channel, so communication is guaranteed to be safe
00047  * (unless, of course, if the spawn server itself is a trojan).
00048  *
00049  * The server will try to keep the spawning time as small as possible, by keeping
00050  * corresponding Ruby on Rails frameworks and application code in memory. So the second
00051  * time an instance of the same application is spawned, the spawn time is significantly
00052  * lower than the first time. Nevertheless, spawning is a relatively expensive operation
00053  * (compared to the processing of a typical HTTP request/response), and so should be
00054  * avoided whenever possible.
00055  *
00056  * See the documentation of the spawn server for full implementation details.
00057  *
00058  * @ingroup Support
00059  */
00060 class SpawnManager {
00061 private:
00062         string spawnServerCommand;
00063         string logFile;
00064         string environment;
00065         string rubyCommand;
00066         
00067         mutex lock;
00068         
00069         MessageChannel channel;
00070         pid_t pid;
00071         bool serverNeedsRestart;

00073         /**
00074          * Restarts the spawn server.
00075          *
00076          * @throws SystemException An error occured while trying to setup the spawn server.
00077          * @throws IOException The specified log file could not be opened.
00078          */
00079         void restartServer() {
00080                 if (pid != 0) {
00081                         channel.close();
00082                         // TODO: should not wait infinitely
00083                         waitpid(pid, NULL, 0);
00084                         pid = 0;
00085                 }
00086                 
00087                 int fds[2];
00088                 FILE *logFileHandle = NULL;
00089                 
00090                 serverNeedsRestart = true;
00091                 if (socketpair(AF_UNIX, SOCK_STREAM, 0, fds) == -1) {
00092                         throw SystemException("Cannot create a Unix socket", errno);
00093                 }
00094                 if (!logFile.empty()) {
00095                         logFileHandle = fopen(logFile.c_str(), "a");
00096                         if (logFileHandle == NULL) {
00097                                 string message("Cannot open log file '");
00098                                 message.append(logFile);
00099                                 message.append("' for writing.");
00100                                 throw IOException(message);
00101                         }
00102                 }
00103 
00104                 pid = fork();
00105                 if (pid == 0) {
00106                         if (!logFile.empty()) {
00107                                 dup2(fileno(logFileHandle), STDERR_FILENO);
00108                                 fclose(logFileHandle);
00109                         }
00110                         dup2(STDERR_FILENO, STDOUT_FILENO);
00111                         if (!environment.empty()) {
00112                                 setenv("RAILS_ENV", environment.c_str(), true);
00113                         }
00114                         dup2(fds[1], STDIN_FILENO);
00115                         close(fds[0]);
00116                         close(fds[1]);
00117                         
00118                         // Close all other file descriptors
00119                         for (long i = sysconf(_SC_OPEN_MAX) - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
00120                                 if (i != STDIN_FILENO && i != STDOUT_FILENO && i != STDERR_FILENO) {
00121                                         close(i);
00122                                 }
00123                         }
00124                         
00125                         execlp(rubyCommand.c_str(), rubyCommand.c_str(), spawnServerCommand.c_str(), NULL);
00126                         int e = errno;
00127                         fprintf(stderr, "*** Passenger ERROR: Could not start the spawn server: %s: %s\n",
00128                                 rubyCommand.c_str(), strerror(e));
00129                         fflush(stderr);
00130                         _exit(1);
00131                 } else if (pid == -1) {
00132                         int e = errno;
00133                         close(fds[0]);
00134                         close(fds[1]);
00135                         if (logFileHandle != NULL) {
00136                                 fclose(logFileHandle);
00137                         }
00138                         pid = 0;
00139                         throw SystemException("Unable to fork a process", e);
00140                 } else {
00141                         close(fds[1]);
00142                         if (!logFile.empty()) {
00143                                 fclose(logFileHandle);
00144                         }
00145                         channel = MessageChannel(fds[0]);
00146                         serverNeedsRestart = false;
00147                 }
00148         }
00149         
00150         /**
00151          * Send the spawn command to the spawn server.
00152          *
00153          * @param appRoot The application root of the application to spawn.
00154          * @param user The user to run the application as.
00155          * @param group The group to run the application as.
00156          * @return An Application smart pointer, representing the spawned application.
00157          * @throws IOException
00158          * @throws SystemException
00159          */
00160         ApplicationPtr sendSpawnCommand(const string &appRoot, const string &user, const string &group) {
00161                 vector<string> args;
00162                 
00163                 channel.write("spawn_application", appRoot.c_str(), user.c_str(), group.c_str(), NULL);
00164                 if (!channel.read(args)) {
00165                         throw IOException("The spawn server has exited unexpectedly.");
00166                 }
00167                 pid_t pid = atoi(args.front().c_str());
00168                 int listenSocket = channel.readFileDescriptor();
00169                 return ApplicationPtr(new Application(appRoot, pid, listenSocket));
00170         }
00171         
00172         template<typename E> ApplicationPtr
00173         handleSpawnException(const E &e, const string &appRoot, const string &user, const string &group) {
00174                 bool restarted;
00175                 try {
00176                         P_DEBUG("Spawn server died. Attempting to restart it...");
00177                         restartServer();
00178                         P_DEBUG("Restart seems to be successful.");
00179                         restarted = true;
00180                 } catch (const IOException &e) {
00181                         P_DEBUG("Restart failed: " << e.what());
00182                         restarted = false;
00183                 } catch (const SystemException &e) {
00184                         P_DEBUG("Restart failed: " << e.what());
00185                         restarted = false;
00186                 }
00187                 if (restarted) {
00188                         return sendSpawnCommand(appRoot, user, group);
00189                 } else {
00190                         string message("Could not spawn the application at '");
00191                         message.append(appRoot);
00192                         message.append("'");
00193                         throw prependMessageToException(e, message);
00194                 }
00195         }
00196         
00197         IOException prependMessageToException(const IOException &e, const string &message) {
00198                 return IOException(message + ": " + e.what());
00199         }
00200         
00201         SystemException prependMessageToException(const SystemException &e, const string &message) {
00202                 return SystemException(message + ": " + e.brief(), e.code());
00203         }

00206         /**
00207          * Construct a new SpawnManager.
00208          *
00209          * @param spawnServerCommand The filename of the spawn server to use.
00210          * @param logFile Specify a log file that the spawn server should use.
00211          *            Messages on its standard output and standard error channels
00212          *            will be written to this log file. If an empty string is
00213          *            specified, no log file will be used, and the spawn server
00214          *            will use the same standard output/error channels as the
00215          *            current process.
00216          * @param environment The RAILS_ENV environment that all RoR applications
00217          *            should use. If an empty string is specified, the current value
00218          *            of the RAILS_ENV environment variable will be used.
00219          * @param rubyCommand The Ruby interpreter's command.
00220          * @throws SystemException An error occured while trying to setup the spawn server.
00221          * @throws IOException The specified log file could not be opened.
00222          */
00223         SpawnManager(const string &spawnServerCommand,
00224                      const string &logFile = "",
00225                      const string &environment = "production",
00226                      const string &rubyCommand = "ruby") {
00227                 this->spawnServerCommand = spawnServerCommand;
00228                 this->logFile = logFile;
00229                 this->environment = environment;
00230                 this->rubyCommand = rubyCommand;
00231                 pid = 0;
00232                 try {
00233                         restartServer();
00234                 } catch (const IOException &e) {
00235                         throw prependMessageToException(e, "Could not start the spawn server");
00236                 } catch (const SystemException &e) {
00237                         throw prependMessageToException(e, "Could not start the spawn server");
00238                 }
00239         }
00240         
00241         ~SpawnManager() throw() {
00242                 if (pid != 0) {
00243                         channel.close();
00244                         waitpid(pid, NULL, 0);
00245                 }
00246         }

00248         /**
00249          * Spawn a new instance of a Ruby on Rails application.
00250          *
00251          * If the spawn server died during the spawning process, then the server
00252          * will be automatically restarted, and another spawn attempt will made made.
00253          * If restarting the server fails, or if the second spawn attempt fails,
00254          * then an exception will be thrown.
00255          *
00256          * @param appRoot The application root of a RoR application, i.e. the folder that
00257          *             contains 'app/', 'public/', 'config/', etc. This must be a valid directory,
00258          *             but the path does not have to be absolute.
00259          * @param user The user to run the instance as.
00260          * @param group The group to run the instance as.
00261          * @return A smart pointer to an Application object, which represents the application
00262          *         instance that has been spawned. Use this object to communicate with the
00263          *         spawned application.
00264          * @throws IOException Something went wrong.
00265          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong.
00266          */
00267         ApplicationPtr spawn(const string &appRoot, const string &user = "", const string &group = "") {
00268                 vector<string> args;
00269                 mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00270                 
00271                 try {
00272                         return sendSpawnCommand(appRoot, user, group);
00273                 } catch (const IOException &e) {
00274                         return handleSpawnException(e, appRoot, user, group);
00275                 } catch (const SystemException &e) {
00276                         return handleSpawnException(e, appRoot, user, group);
00277                 }
00278         }
00279 };
